an6.106:4.1: “Mendicants, you should give up these three cravings and three conceits.
an6.106:4.2: What three cravings should you give up?
an6.106:4.3: Craving for sensual pleasures, craving for continued existence, and craving to exterminate existence.
an6.106:4.4: These are the three cravings you should give up.
an6.106:4.5: What three conceits should you give up?
an6.106:4.6: Conceit, inferiority complex, and superiority complex.
an6.106:4.7: These are the three conceits you should give up.
an6.106:4.8: When a mendicant has given up these three cravings and these three conceits
an6.106:4.9: they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
